claim: Among major European leagues, the 2015/2016 Spain LIGA BBVA season was the most entertaining to watch.
extra_info: league that had the most goals refers to MAX(SUM(home_team_goal, away_team_goal)); 2016 season refers to season = '2015/2016';
reasoning: The 2015/2016 Spain LIGA BBVA season had the most total goals (1043) among all leagues in the database, which per the hint (most entertaining = most goals) confirms the claim.

CREATE TABLE IF NOT EXISTS "Match"

        primary key autoincrement,

input.command: sqlite3 "/Users/david/workspace/claude-code-claimdb/test_dbs/european_football_2.sqlite" "SELECT L.name, SUM(M.home_team_goal + M.away_team_goal) AS total_goals FROM Match M JOIN League L ON M.league_id = L.id WHERE M.season = '2015/2016' GROUP BY L.name ORDER BY total_goals DESC;"
input.description: Get total goals per league for 2015/2016 season

content.content:
Spain LIGA BBVA|1043
England Premier League|1026
Italy Serie A|979
France Ligue 1|960
Netherlands Eredivisie|912
Germany 1. Bundesliga|866
Portugal Liga ZON Sagres|831
Belgium Jupiler League|694
Scotland Premier League|650
Poland Ekstraklasa|635
Switzerland Super League|566

content.text:
The query results show that in the 2015/2016 season, **Spain LIGA BBVA** had the highest total goals (1043), followed by England Premier League (1026). This confirms it was the league with the most goals that season.

Per the hint, "most entertaining to watch" = the league with the most total goals, and "2016 season" = season '2015/2016'. Spain LIGA BBVA indeed had the most goals (1043) among all leagues in the database for that season.
